messages.subject: Re: nose picking
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/24/2004 6:18:47 AM Eastern Standard Time, unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes: I read  an article by some Dr. who suggested nose
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/24/2004 6:18:47 AM Eastern Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:

I read an article by some Dr. who suggested nose picking and booger
eating were good activities to engage in. I'll see if I can find it. I
think Dana Hoffman sent it to me and if she's on this list maybe she
still has it and will send it first.




********************************************
When Julian was still in school he had a serious nose-picking habit, and it
drove me crazy. Well, at one point when he was in his last year there, third
grade, I went to his class because they had a friend who was a storyteller
coming.

The kids all sat on the floor around Tony...and EVERY kid quietly picked
their nose happily the entire time. I swear, it was a sight to behold,
twenty-something eight year olds, and every one a nose-picker. I decided at that point
it was best to lighten up.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
